intro: Garnotia fragilis var. latior, commonly known as the broadleaf garnotia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercialized.
